author: eagle
title: Translate Pool Peek Mobile: Swahili
description: It is not straight forward for non-English speaking users to onboard into the Cardano ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is very much in line with the objectives of the challenge and is really very relevant to Cardano. The bidder already has a highly rated app on the playstore that instructs users on how to buy Ada and how to delegate in a stake pool. In the case of this proposal, the idea is to translate the content of the entire application into the Sualí language, so that speakers of that language have easy access to the content, since the language barrier would be broken. This meets the objectives of the challenge in a precise way, because at the same time it will benefit the speakers of Swali, which is a language that I have seen being addressed in several proposals of the African challenge, it will also contribute to the popularization of our blockchain. We need to make an investment in making Cardano's technologies accessible to everyone, as the difference between content in English and other languages ​​is blatant, so much so that this issue in itself has already been the subject of a challenge. We also have the fact that most stake pools are created by the European and North American community, since blockchain is more popular in these locations, so this type of investment needs to be taken to other audiences. I believe that, as people from other locations (such as Africa) become more knowledgeable about the processes they say about Cardano, more projects will be created in these communities. In other words, perhaps Swali speakers, when they understand some possibilities that could be made, such as this type of investment, become interested in Cardano's technologies and can become more involved in the community, becoming active members. With this, more digital wallets will be created, more Ada will be delegated, probably the level of participation in Catalyst will increase, maybe we will have more Swali speakers studying about the possibilities of our blockchain and maybe in the future working on different projects and so on. What I'm trying to justify is that, through a gateway (like a Dapp that is focused on the native language), many people can be attracted to our community, which would generate extra income opportunities for them, but at the same time could bring several benefits to the Cardano ecosystem. However, one suggestion I would like to make for this project would be to include a short guide. It could perhaps be in mixed format, that is, containing videos, texts and images; the guide would aim to explain the main concepts of the cryptographic world, such as what is blockchain, cryptocurrency, a pool and etc. This could educate people who have downloaded Dapp out of curiosity but who have no prior knowledge of the subject. In general, there is a lot of confidence that the KPIs of the challenge will be addressed, such as those present in the challenge summary “number of new Africa-based Catalyst members (proposers, voters, CAs), number of new African projects seeded in 2022 , number of African developers onboarded in 2022, local impact (measurable through user activity and reach), local partnerships formed (size of institution + influence)”, etc.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is simple to execute, but this does not rule out the need for a more detailed planning of activities. We know that the main job here would be translation. With that, we would need to know how this process would take place. How long would it take for Dapp to be translated, in total? What would the work routine of the professional who would be responsible for this be like? It would be important to know how many hours per week the translator would dedicate to this project and how this activity would happen in practice. Another script issue that could have been included would be the translator selection process - it is not clear if the proponent already has a professional in mind or if this one would still be called to participate in the project. If you are still hired, how would the selection process take place? Another activity that I think could be part of this project would be to include a marketing plan: how would the translated Dapp reach the knowledge of Swali speakers? Moving on to the next topic of analysis, which is the budgetary part, the amount requested is quite low compared to other Catalyst proposals, but it would still be important for it to be better explained, to justify how the money would be used. $2,000 is requested for translation and $400 for development. What would the developer's job be here? How many hours would the translator work so that we would know the value of his working hour? It would be interesting if we had a better understanding, the value above can be fair or very high, depending on the amount of content that would have to be worked on here. And finally, talking about the team, unfortunately there is not much confidence in this part, again due to the lack of detail. We don't know who the bidder is, exactly. This app is said to already have several translations - into which languages? Did the translations work, that is, was a new audience added based on breaking down language barriers? The proponent claims that he has 10 years of experience with application development, so it would be nice if he had exemplified some of his previous work, so that more confidence was conveyed overall. The main thing here, however, would be that the translator was already selected and that he/she demonstrates practical experience with translating the language in question, also exemplifying some projects in which he has previously been involved. Unfortunately, this topic is not very suitable and needs some improvement.
f6_assessments.q2: The auditability of this proposal is not good, unfortunately. We have no means of auditing the suggested progress. It would be necessary for the proponent to define a more detailed roadmap, a schedule of activities that could be monitored. For example, in week 1, the translation could start (it is not stated how long this would take, but let's say in two weeks it would be ready). From week 3 onwards, the translated Dapp would be disseminated to the target audience, etc. In other words, a script that would give us a better understanding of what would be done, when and how, both in terms of the translation itself and in the activities surrounding the main one. As this part of the proposal is presented to us, we have no tangible material to audit; the proponent also does not demonstrate that it will maintain contact with the Cardano community during the process, which would also be necessary. Talking now about the ultimate success, this is defined by “Thousands of Swahili-speaking users in Africa will download and use the app, learn how to stake their Cardano, and buy and delegate Ada to a community participation pool”. For sure our main goal is this, that as many people as possible were downloading Dapp and delegating Ada from it. But how could we measure the consequences of this for Cardano? Could it be that, in addition to the increase in Ada investors, new active members have been added to the community? Have Swali speakers, in addition to the delegation, become involved with Cardano in other ways (for example, are they participating in Catalyst as CAs, vCAs or proponents…?). How can we substantiate the more general benefits that Dapp was responsible for for the African population? Quantitative and qualitative data should be studied, in my view; and these should be brought to the attention of the Cardano community in a very direct way, for example, the proponent could prepare a final report of this project that would indicate what were the advantages presented to Cardano from the translation of his Dapp and in what way the African speakers of that language have benefited beyond the direct use of Dapp. So, unfortunately I will give it 2 stars, I believe it is necessary for the proposer to pay more attention to this part of the proposal, attaching more detail and making it safer to monitor.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal offers to translate into Swahili an existing web-app named “Pool Peek Mobile”. This web app educates and assists new Cardano users about staking, includes a pool map and a pool search engine. 
This app has good reviews in Google and Apple app stores, and after having tested it myself, I found it useful.
Even if Swahili is a widely spoken language in Africa, so is English. The proposer does not show how this proposal will widely contribute to make Cardano the blockchain of choice in Africa. Indication about the evaluation of potential new users would enable a higher impact score.
f6_assessments.q1: The team intends to hire a professional translation service to support the work and evaluates the budget is 2kUSD. There should be no difficulty to perform this task, but the proposer could have made it more clear by adding precisions about what the team has done so far to source this external translation skill.
f6_assessments.q2: Success being defined as “the publication of the app on Google Play Store and Apple App store in Swahili” is not well aligned with the challenge brief. I recommend for a further application on Catalyst to include metrics that clearly relates the goal of the proposal to the challenge brief. In this case, for the “Grow Africa, Grow Cardano” challenge, it is for example: Number of African developers onboarded in 2022, local impact, local partnerships.

f6_assessments.q0: We believe that the objective of the proposal is well aligned with the goals of the challenge, since the availability of the application in this African language will make the Cardano ecosystem gain greater visibility on the continent. It is also interesting to note that with the expansion of other Cardano services on the continent, the use of this application tends to become even greater, as more people will hold crypto assets and will look for a way to allocate them. With this, we have a positive impact in the medium and long term for the ecosystem with the success of this proposal. Furthermore, we realized that the task to be performed is not so complex, but in the same way a very large amount is not being requested. All these factors, along with the fact that the app already exists, make us believe in the project's impact.
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding the feasibility of the project, we found succinct and direct explanations, which seems perfectly consistent with the purposes of the proposal. In fact, if funding does occur, there don't seem to be many risks that need to be mitigated for everything to flow correctly in the translation process. However, it is worth mentioning that some points could be better detailed. For example, the use of a professional service was mentioned for the translation to be carried out, but it would be nice to know specifically what this service will be and what its average cost will be, even to be able to relate this to the amount of $2,000 being requested for translation costs. . The amount being asked for the development seems quite fair, and as the professional mentioned in the proposal has extensive experience in mobile development, we believe that there will be no problems in this action. Another positive factor is that the application in question has already been launched and used by several users (and even translated into other languages), which leads us to believe in the feasibility of this project. But there is the observation that it would be interesting to have some amount dedicated to the marketing of the application. After all, although it is already ready and functional, with the translation a new audience will be reached, and it also seems important that the application is simultaneously introduced to this new group.
f6_assessments.q2: The perception of success that was conveyed is quite consistent with what the project proposes to deliver. However, regarding the metrics chosen to understand the development of the project, we see that the exposed idea makes sense, but does not provide points that better describe the evolution of the proposal. In fact, the launch of the translated application is a good parameter, but it would be interesting to observe additional factors such as the number of users who started using the application and previously did not because of the language barrier or if there was an increase in the number of pools developed in Africa after translation. In addition, some quantitative targets could be established to facilitate the judgment on whether the translation project was successful or not.

f6_assessments.q0:
Solution & Challenge: I still haven't seen the team have specific explanations of their solution to the Problem Satement: "It is not straight forward for non-English speaking users to onboard into the Cardano ecosystem.". What functions does Pool Peek's App include? How does the team reach out to people who want to staking? What makes users have to download this app to their phone instead of other apps on the market today? After the app is translated into Swahili, how can the Swahili users benefit from this app?
When I download the app to my phone to experience. I have a few feelings such as:
- App is quite slow when I select features.
- I really don't know how to use the app and still don't understand the purpose of the app to help users.
- Pool Map features and filter pool by criteria are also quite interesting.
- One thing that is unusual is that no matter how I choose the parameters of the pools, the first pool that the app recommends is always the pool of Pool Peek developers. Is this fair when the developer team always directs users to stake into their pool?
- In the staking basics section in the app (instructions for staking users), the instructions are all text, so it is difficult for someone who doesn't know anything about staking to follow and stake into the pools.

Suggestions:
- The team should come up with marketing plans for the app after the app is translated into Swahili to reach out to Swahili users. Only in this way can it make an impact on the Swahili user community.
- In the solution part of the proposal, I think the team should explain more clearly what are the benefits of users when using the app. What is only in the Pool Peek app that can help users that other apps or websites can hardly do (Unique points)
- Instead of deploying an app that needs to be downloaded to the phone, I think the team should make a website that will have better perfomance and more convenience for users. Because staking is something that doesn't need to be done often. A person usually only staking 1-2 times, so downloading the app to the phone to make 1 staking is not necessary.
- Teams should eliminate the need to always put the team's pool on the first choice regardless of the user's filter parameters. This is not fair at all.
- In the staking tutorial, the team should put pictures and videos of staking instructions into the app, it will be easier for users to do staking than reading the text in the app without illustrations.
Hope the team can improve their proposal better with these tips. As for this proposal, I have to give 2 *
f6_assessments.q1:
Detailed plan: The team does not have a plan to implement this proposal.
"This is easily achievable as we have already translated the application into multiple foreign languages."
How many months will Proposal take? Who will do the translation for this app? How long does the translation take? How many words will be translated in this app?
The team has also not released versions with other languages ​​of the app in this proposal to prove that the team can do translation for this app.

Budget breakdown: Proposal doesn't have a clear budget breakdown for app execution. $2,000 translation costs need to be clear why it's $2,000. How many words in the app will be translated? What is the cost per translated word?
Development costs are how many developers? How long will the developers work on this proposal? How much does it cost for developers to put translations into this app?

The team: I don't see the proposer mentioning the team's information in this proposal.
Who will do the Swahili translation for the app? What is the person's relevant experience like? Who will do the work of putting the translations in the app? What is their experience?
"We will use a professional translation service to support the translation." - The team needs to give specific information about the company that will provide professional translation service
"The primary developer for this mobile application has over 10 years of mobile development experience and his applications have been downloaded from the Google Play and Apple App Stores several million times." - What is this developer's name, Github or linkedin? There is no evidence for this developer's experience in the proposal

Suggestions:
- The team should come up with a specific plan to implement this proposal to demonstrate the team's ability to perform with suggestions such as: How long does the proposal take? How many words will the team translate in the app?
- App versions of other languages ​​should be included in the proposal to demonstrate that the team has implemented many different languages ​​for the app.
- Budget breakdown needs to be more detailed about the cost for each task in the proposal. Example: App has 5,000 English words to translate. Cost per word translated into Swahili is 0.4$ -> Total cost of translation: 2,000$
- Information about the members implementing the proposal and their related experience should be given specifically in the proposal with relevant links (github, linkedin,...) to demonstrate the team's ability to implement the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
The results of the proposal are measurable by the application published to both Google Play and Apple App Store in Swahili. But the team has not come up with a way or an indicator that can measure the progress of the proposal.
Proposer also has not given the time to implement this proposal for how long (1 month, 6 months or 1 year?) If the proposer does not give how long to implement the proposal, it is difficult to know when the proposal will be. will finish.
"Thousands of Swahili-speaking users in Africa will download and use the application, learn how to stake their Cardano, and purchase and delegate Ada to a community stake pool." - How many thousands? How to check that amount? Proposer also did not specifically mention how the team will measure the number of people using the app (maybe the number of downloads on Google Play and the App Store, the proposer should specify the measurement method in the proposal). How does the team measure the number of ADA purchasers and ADA delegates to stake pool after using this app?

Suggestions:
- Proposer should provide a detailed plan with tasks in a defined period of time so that each task can be measured and the proposed implementation time can be clearly determined. Only then can the community and the team measure the progress of the proposal
A specific goal of App Store and Google Play downloads is essential to measure the success and impact of the proposal for Swahili users who want to staking ADA.
- It will be a bit difficult to measure the number of ADA buyers and delegates after using this App. To measure the success and benefits of the app for users. The team can create a category "Feedback & Rate us" in the app so that users can give feedback and rate the app after they use the app.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a relevant proposal with potential to add value to the Cardano ecosystem. By translating the app Pool Peek into Swahili potentially millions of new users can be added to the app (Swahili speakers that do not master the other languages provided by the app). This way these new users can learn how to stake their ADA and get more acquainted with the whole Cardano environment therefore increasing the adoption of Cardano in Africa. No explicit KPIs were given in the proposal but it was mentioned what they see as success. Still, it is preferrable to clearly state the metrics that will be used to track the progress of the plan so we can assess if they are really aligned with the challenge goals. For example, I would suggest a KPI to track the number of new downloads of the app after the version with the new feature is released.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has claimed to have over 10 years of mobile development experience, which would be more than enough to perform this task. However, no links were provided to back that information and not even the name of the developer was mentioned. The budget provided is reasonable and clearly indicates where the resources will be allocated even though it is extremely simples (two lines). No timetable was presented which is pretty concerning. Despite the plan being relatively simple no concrete, sensible plan was designed. They don't mention if they already have a partner translator or if they will have to seek one. They don't say how the work of the developer and the work of the translator will be connected and if they will release the translated version for a few users first as a test, for example, before releasing to the general public. Finally, they are being a bit presumptuous when they claim there are no risks because they have implemented other translations in the past. What if they find more bugs than they anticipated when developing this feature? What if they cannot find a translator with the amount they have defined in the budget? What if any of the platforms has some kind of restriction in place because of the new language being used? These are all questions they could have asked to try to mitigate beforehand.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no roadmap provided. Even though the project is simple they could have broken down in some stages such as hiring the translator, defining how the work process will be run between developer and translator, deciding how many sprints will be necessary to reach the goal and which will be the deliverables of each step. Also, no clear KPIs were given. Two straightforward ones that I can think of are the number of new app downloads after the version with the new feature is released and the average of the grades received after the version is released. Finally, they have not provided any channel to regularly update the community about the progress of their work. It does not matter if the amount of funding is small, the bare minimum the community deserves for funding the project is to know if the work being done is according to what was promised.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer/s has stated that their translated app will give more African people the confidence to invest into Cardano. Whilst this is a good idea it won't directly raise adoption for Cardano as it won't get more African people involved it will just give them more "confidence" to invest. Something to add next time would be some more details on what the app does. The proposer/s stated that their app assists user with the staking process but it doesn't say how it does so or what else the app can do.
f6_assessments.q1: Their plan may not be implemented successfully as the plan does lack some details to who will be translating the app, how they will be translating it and how long they expect it to take as well as some key milestones. The proposer/s have already translated their app into other languages previously and have experience in the area. They also have a clear budget breakdown which explains what each part of the $2400 is going to.
f6_assessments.q2: Success for this proposal is their app being published and accessible to Swahili speaking people which makes its success easily auditable. It would be harder to audit their progress though as there is no measurable milestones and no timeline in their plan. Success for them would also be considered as thousands of people downloading their app. Although this is a great goal it would be hard to measure its success as there is no specific number.

f6_assessments.q0: I've tried the web app. It's incredible and useful for Cardano communities. But one thing to be confirmed: as this proposal ask to translate the web in Swahili, why choose Swahili? If proposer can give the reason why, I think it will be a plus thing and can be consider to vote for the communities because the reason behind it is understandable. it could be an infographic or something like that.
f6_assessments.q1:
I can not find any languages option in the web app, so I have to check the app's update (version history) about the languages added in to it. So Proposer already done this kind of work, and it will be an easy task for them.
Budget are too simple in this proposal, I think proposer could add who are the team who will do the translation tasks. It will be nice if we can check their relevant experience. Also, timetable in the proposal is needed too! Next time, if Proposer ask for a funding again, Proposer could add realistic timetable in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Since it's a translation task for an app, roadmap isn't needed in the proposal. And the success of it can be check in version update (on App Store / Play Store). Maybe Proposer could add how to promote it in some specific local communities in the key metrics. Users growth could be a success metrics too!

f6_assessments.q0: Proposing to translate into Swahili through the Pool Peek Mobile tool to assist users in the transaction process, the project already has an application and this is an extension of it, extending it to a community of users. Using Swahili language where learners can translate content to buy and authorize Ada for the community stake group, along with the strong growth of the Cardano ecosystem, more and more people are learning how to invest with background. Therefore, the more translations for tools like Pool Peek Mobile, the more people understand and invest in the Cardano platform through the translation. Therefore, it can be said that the proposal has a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem in the future, and is suitable for challenging purposes. Advice, I think it would be helpful if the proponent included in the app a basic tutorial all about Cardano in Swahili with pictures or videos, making it easy for newbies to understand and operate, and can also try to trust with users more.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is well prepared when the application is available, we can easily search and download the application to experience on Google Play and Apple App, the application is built and developed by an experienced person, we can contact developer on google play store: support@colorworkapps.com. The biggest challenge for this proposal is the work of performing the translations of the application, which the proponent also has experience in doing with other languages ​​before, so it will not be difficult to expand to other languages. another new language. But would it be better for the proponent to be able to point out some relevant information about the translator such as experience and skills and if they have knowledge of the Cardano ecosystem? To add more credibility to voter evaluation. Regarding the budget mainly spent on translation with 2000 USD I find it quite reasonable because it is the most challenging job for the proposal, 400 USD for development costs, because it is quite a job. Simply put, when the application has been built and developed by an experienced person, it is a pretty reasonable deal. The proponent also raised the risk challenge and proposed measures to limit the risk of successfully implementing the project. From the above I think it is very likely that the proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proponent did not provide a roadmap with clear timelines for successful implementation of the proposal. For example, it takes a few days to find a translator, to translate the content for a few days, and to develop and complete the proposed content in a few days, so that when the voting community looks at it, it will be easier to monitor and evaluate the progress of the work. the job, the proposer knows where he is working to try to complete. The proponent has provided a KPI, but it would be more interesting if you gave more specific numbers so that the voter community can more easily evaluate and measure, for example the number of downloads down in one area, Number of Swahili users joining the ecosystem through the app. I think that if you provide this information fully, the community will appreciate it much more.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal offers to translate into Swahili a web application known as “Pool Peek Mobile”. This web app, which can be found on the Google Play and Apple App stores, provides new Cardano users with information and assistance about staking, as well as pool map and pool search engine. Nevertheless, the proposer does not demonstrate how this idea would significantly contribute to making Cardano the blockchain of choice in Swahili-speaking countries, despite the fact that Swahili is one of the most commonly spoken languages in Africa. With regard to the explanation of the solutions, it is vital to remark about what types of expectations there are for the application or how it will affect on the community in order to boost the number of users in Africa. The proposal should include further details regarding the extent to which it would bring the Swahili community closer to the Cardano ecosystem.
If additional information is provided, the proposal, in my opinion, will have a more significant influence, and the community will have an easier time determining the degree to which the project was successful.
f6_assessments.q1:
Because this idea is based on an app that has already been constructed, and because the team has previously completed the effort of translating it many times, it is likely to be successful.
Nevertheless, it would be helpful to show a road map that is more explicit, complete with weekly and monthly time periods. The author of the project did not include any information on how long the process of translating the application would take approximately. It is difficult for me to determine the outcome of the project based on the strategy that is currently in place. Budgeting was another topic that was explored, but not in as much depth as the others. The proposer may include further details on the translator's expenditures, such as the amount of the translator's salary (expressed either in words or translations) and the development costs that are covered.
Even if the team has already done translation before, I would still want additional information about what and when each step of the assignment will be executed during the project so that I can make a more accurate assessment of how the budget will be used. It is also more dependable if there is a link or reference to a professional translation service that the team plans to hire.
f6_assessments.q2:
The information that is now available is insufficient to provide a proper evaluation of the openness and possibility of the project's success. The success criteria outlined by the proposer include uploading the app to both the Google Play Store and the Apple Store, but no more information on publishing dates is supplied. Regarding the planning aspect of the project, I believe that there need to be a particular plan in place on a weekly or monthly basis. During this stage, proposer should also be establishing a deadline for the work and disclosing the information to the community through some form of public documentation.
In order to keep track of how successful the production will be, there ought to be some quantitative metrics in place. For example, it is quite unlikely that the finished software will be successful if just a limited number of users use it.

f6_assessments.q0:
Since it is a problem and not easy for non-English speaking users to board the Cardano ecosystem, “Pool Peek Mobile” has been built to help users and this app will be translated to Swahili (~200 million African speakers). The “Pool Peek Mobilel” solution has already been translated into several languages and has an average rating of 4.5 stars in the Google Play and Apple App stores. This proposal will certainly add value to the Cardano ecosystem.
We will work with a professional translator to translate the “Pool Peek Mobile” application and app store listing as it has been done with the other languages. The result is a mobile application that is easy to find when searching for foreign language terms on the Play Store and an app that is easy to use, allowing speakers to find resources in their native language.
The resulting application will give Swahili speakers the confidence that the Cardano ecosystem is working to expand to support non-English speaking users and thus give them the confidence to invest in Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1:
Other than the need for a professional translator for the proposal, no detailed description of the team members is required.
This proposal is easily feasible because the application has already been translated into several foreign languages. A relevant link of the application has been added (https://pool-peek.web.app/#/).
The primary developer of this mobile application has over 10 years of experience in mobile development and its applications have been downloaded millions of times from the Google Play and Apple App Stores. A professional translation service will be used to support the translation.
The budget is described but not in detail and therefore needs to be better divided and elaborated. As the app is already available in several languages, the budget provided in the proposal will be sufficient and no further additional funding will be required.
A timetable to implement the proposal is not available in the proposal. A successful implementation will not be a problem as it is already available in several languages.
f6_assessments.q2: No roadmap with milestones and no time horizon for realization has been described. The main objective of this project is to give thousands of Swahili speaking users access to their application. This will ensure that again a larger target group will be addressed, who will thus gain access to the Cardano-ecosystem. The petitioner describes the problem that Swahilli speakers have difficulty accessing the Cardano ecosystem due to the language barrier. Due to the translation of this application, there will be no more language barrier and the people will get involved faster.

f6_assessments.q0:
[Disclaimer: The proposer has submitted 2 proposals that are related to hiring a translator team to translate their app to (1) Vietnamese and (2) Swahili. These proposals are very similar in their goal and structure. As a result, the assessments for this set of proposals will also be similar]

The premise of this proposal is pretty simple which is to translate their Cardano Stake Pool app to have Swahili language support. The project is definitely aligned with the challenge setting objective of growing Cardano’s outreach and adoption in East Asia by providing accessibility to users who can understand crypto terminology better in their native language. One challenge I think that was not discussed sufficiently (in my view) is regarding how the proposer will on-board users since presumably the Swahili-speaking users who are already using the app can understand it in English already.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer is the developer of the app that is going to be translated, which by the claim of the proposer has already been translated in several languages. After doing a bit of searching on the internet, it has been translated to Korean and French based on the latest update note on App Store. One thing for voter to note is that the proposer’s claim of the app having a 4.5 average rating on Play Store and App Store while true, only has 21 reviews on Play Store and 3 reviews on App Store.

Even if as the proposer stated that the proposal is easily achievable since they have already translated the app into several languages, I still think that they should’ve provided some kind of timeline even as simple as a start and end date since it will allow us to evaluate the project better and it can act as an auditing tool to track the project’s progress/completion.

The budget has been divided into identifiable items, such as the translation fee and the development cost. I personally would have liked if the proposer included the breakdown for this cost. For example the translation fee can details the number of words or total workhours and the rate requested (can be word count basis or work hours basis) by the hired translation team so that the budget can be evaluated better.
f6_assessments.q2: I think the proposer should’ve added KPIs to measure the project’s success regarding how many Swahili speaking users downloading the app, this was mentioned briefly but the proposer did not explain how the downloads from that specific demographic can be tracked and reported. Additionally, the project’s progress is hard to audit since while the update note can be easily seen via App Store or Play Store, the proposer didn’t mention the set end date for this project and what the target timeframe of implementation is.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal seeks to make it possible for non-English speakers in Africa to on-board into cardano ecosystem.
